entry.title: [DSE] Fix an issue with enabling "EEA country only".
entry.content:
When the parameter "Enable EEA country only" is enabled, it checks

the shared preference whether "IS_EEA_CHOICE_COUNTRY" is set to be

true. However, if it is false, the check

#isNewTabSearchEngineUrlAndroidEnabled() returns false and DseNewTabUrlManager isn't created, and thus it won't set the

"IS_EEA_CHOICE_COUNTRY" in the sharedPreference. In this CL, we will

force to create the DseNewTabUrlManager as long as the feature flag

"NewTabSearchEngineUrlAndroid" is enabled.



Bug: 40279491

Change-Id: I3280c13d4548a6f24075bfcef47099ab7fae17e8

entry.title: pine: Resize the pine image to be smaller before encoding and saving it
entry.content:
Resize the pine image to be smaller before encoding and saving it.

As encoding and saving a smaller image will be faster, this will also

decrease the time needed to decode it later.

See the tests run with resizing the output to be 1/2 size of the

source size at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XF4-trOMz3P2Ix5Fqb7fvOvQ2_HyTS5kIGnK9IcGyuY/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ayr5wwcdm1b0

entry.title: Make Lightweight UAF Detector reports less confusing
entry.content:
At the moment, we report UAF crashes detected by LUD as

"lightweight-heap-use-after-free" and people are confused about what is

lightweight about them.



This change introduces a new field to the GWP-ASan proto that

represents the GWP-ASan mode and complements a similar backend change.

entry.title: Rename SaveUpdateAddressProfileIcon* to AddressBubblesIcon*.
entry.content:
This CL is a part of the work on separating SaveUpdateAddressProfile*

into the "Save" and "Update" parts. High level (not necessarily matching

the CLs) overview of the work to be done:

* Split `SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleControllerImpl` into 3 (or 4)

parts:

* `AddressBubbleController` - shows/hides specific bubbles,

controls the page action icon

* `SaveAddressBubbleController` - save-relevant methods from

`SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleController`

* `UpdateAddressBubbleController` - update-relevant methods

* Maybe `BaseAddressBubbleController` - common methods from

`SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleController`

* Move the bubble type decision to

`ChromeAutofillClient::ConfirmSaveAddressProfile`

* Rename `SaveUpdateAddressProfileIconController` to

`AutofillAddressIconController`

* Rename `PageActionIconType::kSaveAutofillAddress` to

`PageActionIconType::kAutofillAddress`

* Later (out of scope of this refactoring, but dependent on it): add

the "Add new address" bubble.



Bug: 325440757

Change-Id: Ie1e6151534b57426731e9f9c8a49d3048780bed0

entry.title: [iOS] Add DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK to detect shutdown issues in SettingsTableVC
entry.content:
A crash in the SettingsTableViewController related to observation of the

ChromeAccountManagerService is suspected to be fixed / no longer

reproduceable. To confirm, This CL adds a DUMP_WILL_BE_CHECK to the

shutdown event of the observer. If the crash is indeed fixed, this code

will never get reached.



Bug: 328252472, 40926211

Change-Id: I0f478ade32971680f39d63d342274bba02ae49c8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5352813

Commit-Queue: Guillaume Jenkins

Reviewed-by: Jérôme Lebel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269782}

entry.title: Revert "[E2E] Set the right navigation bar color when going from E2E to non E2E"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 75526549fc5824598755d0d0bd1234e96fa4f6d0.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5716439195451392



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8754168378723984817

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest#testCloseEvent](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:chrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest%23testCloseEvent?q=VHash%3Abef5e9ca568b6d53)

[ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest#testCustomFullRatio](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:chrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest%23testCustomFullRatio?q=VHash%3Abef5e9ca568b6d53)

[ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest#testCustomScrimLifecycle](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:chrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest%23testCustomScrimLifecycle?q=VHash%3Abef5e9ca568b6d53)

[ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest#testHandleBackPress_noIntercept](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:chrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest%23testHandleBackPress_noIntercept?q=VHash%3Abef5e9ca568b6d53)

[ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest#testHandleBackPress_noIntercept_Refactored](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:chrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.widget.bottomsheet.BottomSheetControllerTest%23testHandleBackPress_noIntercept_Refactored?q=VHash%3Abef5e9ca568b6d53)

and 8 more ...



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5716439195451392&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5346729&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> [E2E] Set the right navigation bar color when going from E2E to non E2E

>

> Before: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5445338855899136

> After: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5793187317678080

>

> Verification steps:

> 1. Enable E2e flags (#draw-cutout-edge-to-edge and #draw-edge-to-edge)

> 2. Make sure you're in light theme

> 3. Go to a page that doesn't support E2E (ex: Wikipedia). The navigation bar should be white in light theme.

> 4. Go to a page that supports E2E (ex: Apple.com)

> 5. Navigate back to Wikipedia (I used back gesture in gesture navigation mode). Before: navigation bar shows up black. After: navigation bar shows up as the right color.

>

> Fixed: b/41485486

> Change-Id: I9d54821c91ee14f1fcbc44ffdedb75d714f63bf2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5346729

> Reviewed-by: Lijin Shen

> Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

> Commit-Queue: Geoff Huang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269298}

>

entry.title: ash: Fix top level dialogs not marked as SYSTEM_APP
entry.content:
`ChromeViewsDelegate` marks dialogs with no parent as SYSTEM_APP

in `OnBeforeWidgetInit`. However, the code uses `IsDialogBox`.

That method depends on `widget_delegate_` being set properly.

So it no longer works under `OnBeforeWidgetInit` because

`widget_delegate_` is set afterwards now. This CL fixes

the issue by checking dialog using `params.delegate`.



Bug: b/321597004

Change-Id: I20f42fe4810fa5691d29bc89172cb74f4abcc688

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5350998

Commit-Queue: Xiyuan Xia

Reviewed-by: Allen Bauer

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269776}

entry.title: Clean up OSExchangeDataProviderMac's CONVERT_FILENAMES
entry.content:
The comment was incorrect. The issue was that macOS always appends

a slash for a directory URL, and thus breaks the round trip. Given

that files are what are used anyway, change the test to use a

file.



Also remove the "localhost" wiggleroom in the test; I don't believe

that any supported version of macOS does that any more.



Bug: 41403933

Change-Id: Ie7bfeb48321f026de7c1f5aa7959b4c0ee5c8353

entry.title: [gtm] Implement showing cached tasks before fetching
entry.content:
This cl implements showing cached tasks that was fetched before in the

current session.



Original process to fetch data is to invalidate cache whenever the

glanceables is closed. The next time the glanceables is opened, the

task client considers that the data fetch is needed and does so, even

though the cached data exists.



In this change, we don't invalidate cache when the glanceables is

closed. In addition, we try getting the cached task lists and tasks

if they exist, and then force fetch the updated data at the same time.

Whenever the new data arrives, the views are updated.



Bug: b/321789067

entry.title: Clean up histograms at the end of StatisticsRecorderStarvationTest
entry.content:
Does so by deleting the Histogram objects. Hopefully this is good

enough to release the majority of the memory allocated during this

test. Since the histograms are allocated on the heap, then their

samples are backed by std::vector, which is owned by the Histogram

object itself. So deleting the Histogram object should also release

the samples vector. Code pointer:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/metrics/histogram.cc;l=592;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090



This is in contrast to when a persistent allocator is present.

Deleting the histogram would not release the underlying storage.

Yes, we could just release the underlying storage as well, but the

issue is that when allocating histograms, if the persistent storage

is full, we allocate the storage on the heap instead, but that storage

isn't owned by the Histogram object (it is just leaked). So cleaning

those up would require some plumbing.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/metrics/sample_vector.cc;l=675;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090



There's unfortunately still some leaked memory, but it should be

trivial enough. In particular, for Histograms allocated on the heap,

their name is stored in some global set.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/metrics/histogram_base.cc;l=252;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090



Fixed: 41489801

Change-Id: I0a79717f65f4ca59b44a802c841c916ef888f8a3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349239

entry.title: android: orderfile: exclude helpers from instrumentation
entry.content:
The AreAnchorsSane() is called from instrumentation (via

__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare and RecordAddress()). It seems that for

most configurations in use today this function is inlined.



However, if it does not get inlined, it recurses into

__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare again.



Exclude it from instrumentation, along with the IsOrderfingSane().

Missing these functions in the profile is not ideal. We can add them to

the orderfile later. This is a speculative fix for the bot running arm64

instrumentation.

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: fix OOP-VD frame lifecycle bug
entry.content:
When crrev.com/c/5304577 migrated

|OOPVideoDecoder::generic_id_to_decoded_frame_map_|, it exposed a bug in

VideoFrameResource where wrapping a frame would guarantee that the

underlying VideoFrame of the original frame would be preserved as long

as the wrapping frame was alive. However, the original FrameResource

itself was not kept alive by the wrapping frame.



This caused a problem where, if a resolution change occurred in a Video,

then the OOPVideoDecoder would clear

|received_id_to_decoded_frame_map_|. This could cause a dangling pointer

in the MailboxVideoFrameConverter.



This lifecycle problem was confirmed with a new unit test. In order to

avoid the issue, VideoFrameResource::CreateWrappingFrame() now adds a

reference to the original VideoFrameResource by the wrapping frame.



Bug: 328259184, b:277581596

Test: Unit test VideoFrameResourceTest:WrappingLifecycle passes

Test: video.Play.*hw* tests pass on Cherry

Test: vda_tests pass and frames get recycled into the frame pool



Change-Id: Ic7a333e76181928908e92dc3ca20dfc73fa3ded6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349926

Reviewed-by: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

Commit-Queue: Andres Calderon Jaramillo

entry.title: Add local state pref to track the effective DoH URI template
entry.content:
On Chrome OS, the logic for tracking the effective DoH URI template is

complex.



Besides the cross-platform policy DnsOverHttpsTemplates, clients on

Chrome OS also need to track the policies

DnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers and DnsOverHttpsSalt. Classes that

share the URI template with services like shill, the NetworkService and

Lacros have to monitor these three prefs to ensure the effective URI

template is correctly configured.



The DnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers contains placeholders for

device and user identifiers, which need to be replaced with real

user or device data to determine the effective URI template.



Additionally, when both DnsOverHttpsTemplates and

DnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers are configured, the latter has

priority.



With the introduction of the IP addresses in the URI template, tracking

changes in the effective URI template will increase in complexity. See

go/ip-for-doh-uri-template.



This CL introduces the local state pref

kDnsOverHttpsEffectiveTemplatesChromeOS which will simplify tracking

the effective URI template on Chrome OS by:



- allowing clients to track one local state pref instead of three;

- only doing placeholder replacement in one place (SecureDnsManager).



Lacros update in the followup CL.



Bug: b/307735537, b/325415682

Change-Id: Icc9a772fb077958e3323bfc33456b76100f04f28

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5303615

entry.title: Refactor HighlightPaintStyle to report fallback color usage
entry.content:
In order to avoid painting highlights in the wrong color, the

highlight layer's text style must fall back to the previous layer

for the same text range, not for the previous layer across the whole

text run.



To enable this, create HighlightStyleUtils::MaybeResolveColors

that returns a color only if it need not fallback to a previous

layer or originating element. Change the return type of

HighlightPaintStyle to use this new resolution mechanism while recording and returning those colors that come from the fallback. And add a method

to resolve those colors using a given previous layer style.



Modify the call sites for the new return values, but do not make use

of it yet. That will come in the final CL which re-arranges the

storage and setting of colors for highlights.



Bug: 41497157

entry.title: [remoting] Move video-capture code out of DesktopSessionProxy.
entry.content:
This moves all the video-capture logic (including shared-memory buffers)

out of DesktopSessionProxy into the existing IpcVideoCapturer class.



Eventually, this will enable DesktopSessionProxy (called from

IpcDesktopEnvironment) to create and manage multiple instances of

IpcVideoCapturer for multi-stream support. Each instance would be

provided with its own Mojo Remote for sending requests, and its own

Receiver for receiving shared-memory and video-frames.

entry.title: Bypass exposure checks for constructors when creating wrappers
entry.content:
Callbacks generated for explicit interface constructors are assigned to interface template unconditionally in case they are exposed per-context [1], and perform exposure checks dynamically when invoked [2]. The callbacks are also invoked when just wrapping internally-created objects [3], in which case they are supposed to set the wrapper and bail out. However, we still perform exposure check and throw, which leads to a CHECK() [4]. We should only perform checks for constructor invocations coming from JS.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/scripts/bind_gen/interface.py;l=5403

[2] https://source.chromium.org/search?q=f:bindings%2Fscripts%2Fbind_gen%2Finterface.py%20make_check_constructor_call

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/bindings/v8_object_constructor.cc;l=51;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090;bpv=1;bpt=1

[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/bindings/v8_per_context_data.cc;l=108





Bug: 328306658

Change-Id: Idfef09b8aa1aafc26cd610233abdd1476dce88f0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5350039

entry.title: Reland "Fix overlapping print page indicator on overlay scrollbars."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 396d08e0cb223ff75592e6d311d1a6f7da1dbb0e



Original change's description:

> Fix overlapping print page indicator on overlay scrollbars.

>

> In Linux and Windows, when Overlay scrollbars are enabled, the page

> indicator that appears next to the scrollbars when scrolling in the

> print page preview gets drawn on top of the scrollbars, instead of next

> to them.

>

> In MacOS, this issue is avoided by hardcoding a 16px margin between the

> edge of the screen and the page indicator. This causes the page

> page indicator to be drawn far enough to not overlap with the overlay

> thumb, and to not overlap with the expanded scrollbars you see when

> mousing over the scrollbars.

>

> This CL expands this margin to also be added when Overlay scrollbars

> are enabled in Windows and Linux (both regular and Fluent Overlay

> scrollbars).

>

> To reproduce this issue:

> 1. In Windows, enable overlay scrollbars via

> chrome://flags/#fluent-overlay-scrollbars

> or chrome://flags/#overlay-scrollbars

> 2. Go to any web page that would be printed in more than one page and

> open the print preview (Ctrl+P).

> 3. Scroll. The floating square with the page indicator gets drawn on

> top of the scrollbar's thumb, instead of floating next to it.

>

> Tested locally in Linux and Windows with both type of scrollbars

> (regular and Fluent) in overlay and non-overlay versions and verified

> that everything worked as expected.

>

> Bug: 1286009

> Change-Id: Ia8b4afa3b7a3dc7490c15314093e02684968a4cb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5247173

> Commit-Queue: Gaston Rodriguez

> Reviewed-by: Demetrios Papadopoulos

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268833}



Bug: 1286009

Change-Id: I03023f3da586f8c18fba132df26af3695ac50adc

entry.title: [UseRecordedBoundsForTiling] Disable SetCurrentScrollCheckerboardsDueToNoRecording
entry.content:
With UseRecordedBoundsForTiling enabled,

checkerboarded_no_recording_content_area means differently from its

original meaning (which was some tiles out of blink interest rect has

become visible) before CompositeAfterPaint. Calling

SetCurrentScrollCheckerboardsDueToNoRecording() may cause unexpected

consequences. Disable it for now, and will clean up after checking

finch data of UseRecordedBoundsForTiling.



With UseRecordedBoundsForTiling disabled,

checkerboard_no_recording_content_area should be always 0 and

CurrentScrollCheckerBoardDueToNoRecording() should be always false

because the recorded bounds is always the same as the layer bounds,

thus this change affects UseRecordedBoundsForTiling only.



Bug: 41490692

Change-Id: Ie8ddc1e57d3c2e0fb69b798794563ed62b4e0613

entry.title: Implement `getTextureFormat` for WebGPU access.
entry.content:
Explainer:

https://github.com/fserb/canvas2D/blob/master/spec/webgpu.md



This will return the texture format of the canvas image. In practice,

this will be RGBA8 or BGRA8 when an SDR canvas is being used. In HDR,

it will be RGBA16F. (Enabling HDR is the only way a user can

currently control the format of a canvas.)

entry.title: Revalidate the interval when SMIL timing parameters change
entry.content:
When one of the 'dur', 'repeatDur', 'repeatCount', 'min' or 'max'

attributes changes the interval will not be revalidated. Since the state

from these are "lazy" we will instead get strange effects when using

timing state for other things.



When any of the attributes above change, then tell the time container to

reschedule the timed element and set a flag so that the interval will be

revalidated when that happens.



Fixed: 328451421

Change-Id: Ia80becaf813e3c734c85ac85bfa483ce325f0786

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5352368

Reviewed-by: Stephen Chenney

Commit-Queue: Stephen Chenney

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269700}

entry.title: wayland: harden dnd data fetching handler
entry.content:
Drag controller's state was being used to determine whether window's

OnDragDataAvailable() was called or not. Though, it turns out that it's

not reliable enough for that. Instead, use the data returned by the

fetch task, which will be null in that case.



The linked crbug seems quite hard to reproduce, though might happen in a

high load scenario, where drag enter -> leave -> enter events are

received in really fast pace, such that fetch tasks are posted to the

thread pool (eg: 3 enters and 2 leaves) and when the first (cancelled)

one completes, the controller state would be (correctly) kFetching, so

the null OSExchangeData pointer was being wrongly delivered all the way

up to DesktopDragDropControllerOzone => WebContentsViewAura, then

causing the null deref attempt.



With this change:

- Only non-null data is delivered to the drag handler;

- A sequenced task runner is used to post the fetch tasks;

- The (unlikely but exploitable) scenario where subsequent drag enters

arrive is properly handled;

- A ScopedBlockingCall is used to ensure MayBlock fetch tasks do not

prevent other tasks from executing in the thread pool.



R=fangzhoug



Bug: 326724593

Change-Id: I878a56d337967a709c1774667d382fedc2ee7b6d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349821

entry.title: Rename SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleControllerImpl.
entry.content:
No functional changes, only renaming

SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleControllerImpl to

AddressBubblesController.



This CL is a part of the work on separating SaveUpdateAddressProfile*

into the "Save" and "Update" parts. High level (not necessarily matching

the CLs) overview of the work to be done:

* Split `SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleControllerImpl` into 3 (or 4)

parts:

* `AddressBubbleController` - shows/hides specific bubbles,

controls the page action icon

* `SaveAddressBubbleController` - save-relevant methods from

`SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleController`

* `UpdateAddressBubbleController` - update-relevant methods

* Maybe `BaseAddressBubbleController` - common methods from

`SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleController`

* Move the bubble type decision to

`ChromeAutofillClient::ConfirmSaveAddressProfile`

* Rename `SaveUpdateAddressProfileIconController` to

`AutofillAddressIconController`

* Rename `PageActionIconType::kSaveAutofillAddress` to

`PageActionIconType::kAutofillAddress`

* Later (out of scope of this refactoring, but dependent on it): add

the "Add new address" bubble.

entry.title: pine: No screenshot on a different display orientation
entry.content:
Do not show the screenshot in the pine dialog if the image and the

display will show it has different orientations. One is landscape

while another is portrait, vice versa.



We are not going to set `image` of the `PineContentsData` in this case.

It is fine to keep the image in the disk, as the pine dialog will only

be shown on startup and the pine image in disk will be either deleted

or overridden on the next shutdown.

entry.title: [A11y] For performance, skip text deletion and insertion events on ignored nodes
entry.content:
Skipping these events on nodes that are either remaining ignored,

were ignored, or are about to be ignored is a significant performance

win for the browser, and likely in ATs as well.



Ignored nodes are not exposed to ATs, and therefore firing change

events on them creates extra work without any benefit.



We were always paying this cost on some nodes, but it became worse

recently after landing stable ids CL:5328829. Previously when nodes

changed from ignored to ignored, the id often

also changed, which caused the AXNode to be a new node, and there was

no old vs new data to compare, preventing this code from running in

the first place.



About 1/3 of the tests had a 5-15% improvement in OnAccessibilityEvents, and the others didn't change significantly.



Bug: b/327473167

entry.title: [iOS] Don't initiate non modal promos when promos cannot be displayed.
entry.content:
It is possible that after logging omnibox copy-paste event but before

the page is fully loaded users background the app. In this code path

there are no checks to make sure that non-modal promo can be displayed.

However on background it will record some histograms. In case when user

maxed out it's impression if we try to record histograms it will result

in a crash.



In this CL, make sure that logging non-modal promo triggering event

nothing will be initiated if promo cannot be displayed.



Bug: b/326565601

entry.title: iOS: Don't use vector<const T> for GetScripts() API
entry.content:
vector isn't standards-compliant and will be a compile

error eventually. See the bug for why it doesn't mean much too,

e.g. comment 16.



(vector is allowed and meaningful, since it applies the

`const` to the pointee, not the pointer.)



While here, also remove a `const` from a return type. Maybe

the `&` was missing and this meant to return a const ref, but

as it was, the `const` there had no effect. (A subclass does

return a temporary in an override, so changing to const ref

isn't easily possible.)



No behavior change.



Bug: 323708866

entry.title: [E2E] Use InsetObserver to manage inset and safe area observation
entry.content:
E2EControllerImpl#pushInsetsToBlink can cause conflict with the other callsite to WebContents#setSafeArea in InsetObserver. This change metigate that by delegating the call to InsetObserver#onSafeAreaChanged.



This change also make OnApplyWindowInsetsListener listening to the InsetObserver, instead of just being an listener to the root view. This should be a no-op from the end behavior, while making InsetObserver the only OnApplyWindowInsetsListener that coordinates different inset signals.



New behavior guarded behind killswitch DrawEdgeToEdgeInsetsManagement.



Bug: 325466918

entry.title: bindings: Put cooperative scheduling safepoint behind gn flag
entry.content:
This disables the general cooperative scheduling safepoint from

auto-generated bindings code. The feature is not launched with an

unclear timeline, so there's no need to pay the price in bindings for

reading TLS state on each call.



The safepoint can be enabled via gn arg

enable_blink_bindings_cooperating_scheduling = true



This shows up in setBindGroup() which is important for WebGPU but also

more generally in all workloads to a minor extent.



Change-Id: Iae656382a68b406c38626d26552fdb7927038828

entry.title: Add user counters for RGB, OkLabOkLch, and out-of-Rec2020
entry.content:
Add counters for the CSS Color Level 4 syntax, dividing the syntax

into the classes of RGB spaces versus OkLab/OkLch (OkLxx). For these

two classes, track how often they specify a color outside of the

Rec2020 gamut.



This is to inform choices about how to handle out-of-range values

in the OkLab/OkLch syntax.



Mark the counters kCSSColorColorSpecifiedSpace, kCSSColorLabOklab,

and kCSSColorLchOklch obsolete, because they were observed not to be

used anymore.



Previously landed in crrev.com/1256189

Reverted in crrev.com/1256383

Reason for revert fixed in crrev.com/1256784

entry.content:
The existing `--force-search-engine-choice-screen` can now also be used

on non-branded builds, allowing them to trigger the choice screen there.



Does not guarantee that all assets on the choice screen will reflect

what is available in branded builds. These should still be used to more

accurately test rendering and triggering.



Suppressing the screenshots because there are no new strings, we

already have them for Chrome branded builds.

entry.title: [CSC][Zoom] Use temporary zoom
entry.content:
Snap back the zoom level after the captured tab is closed.



This ensures that users who are not familiar with how to change

the zoom level don't end up in a state they don't know how to undo.



The change is controlled by the kCapturedSurfaceControlTemporaryZoom

feature flag.

Additionally, we can use a helper method in a separate test.

entry.title: [UNOp2][Android] Allow showing accounts list when sign-in flow starts
entry.content:
When the user selects "Choose Account" from sign-in promo (e.g. in the

bookmark manager"), the new sign-in flow should start and show the

expanded sign-in bottom sheet with an accounts list, instead of the

collapsed one.



A new sign-in bottom sheet mode has been introduced in

https://crrev.com/c/5319169. This CL uses it in the new sign-in flow

(eg. SigninAndHistoryOptInActivityLauncher) to allow sign-in entry

points to select the correct bottom sheet mode according to the user's

action. It also updates and adds tests accordingly.



Bug: 41493769, 41493768
